data.title: Pixiv Encyclopedia: Tanabata
data.text:
What follows is a loose translation of the pixiv entry on July 7th — the holiday of Tanabata in Japan. I figured I’d see what other characters’ birthdays I could rep other than Tsukasa Hiiragi and Kurihara-senpai (above), triggered by a couple of folks repping Senjougahara (Bakemonogatari‘s stapler heroine) on Twitter.

In any case, here you go.

—

July 7th (７月７日 – pronounced “shichigatsu nanoka”) is the 188th day of the year (189th on leap years). On pixiv, there are a lot of Tanabata-related pictures that get posted.

What’s celebrated on this day?

Tanabata

Yukata Day

River Day

Bamboo & Bamboo Shoot Day

Gift Day

Scent Day

Ponytail Day

Hiyasuhi Chuuka (cold Chinese noodle dish) day

In history:

1777: In the American Civil War, the Battle of Harborton.

1798: Mock wars were staged in preparation for real battle.

1807: Alexander made peace with Napoleon at Tilsit.

1898: Hawaii is accepted into the United States of America.

1919: Calpis (Calpico) is first sold.

1978: The Solomon Islands become independent from Britain.

Birthdays

Naoko Ken

MISIA

—

Hmm. Admittedly, I’ve not seen nor played the majority of these series…so, in the end, happy birthday, Tsukasa, Kagami, and Kuri-chan. I’m sure there’s someone out there in the Western fandom for each of the rest of the characters here…somewhere out there.

My Fanime and Anime Expo postmortems to come soon. Anime Expo, which was this past weekend, was quite a bit of fun…and hectic, as usual. I still spent only some 1.5 hours total in the dealer’s hall, sorta like last year.
